intro: Lagascea helianthifolia var. adenocaulis, commonly known as the腺状茎金盏花, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It features a rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in the spring, which are typically arranged in a cluster at the center of the rosette. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
